files.README.md:
# Clawcord

Discord Rich Presence for [Claude Code](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code). Shows your current project, git branch, model, and estimated API cost directly on your Discord profile.

## Installation

### Option A: Plugin marketplace (recommended)

Add the Clawcord marketplace and install the plugin:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add zachthedev/clawcord
/plugin install clawcord@zachthedev-clawcord
```

The daemon binary downloads automatically on first run. Statusline integration is set up at the same time.

### Option B: Local plugin directory

Clone the repository and load it directly:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/zachthedev/clawcord.git
claude --plugin-dir ./clawcord
```

### Option C: Build from source

```bash
go install tools.zach/dev/claude/clawcord/cmd/clawcord@latest
```

Then load the plugin for hooks: `claude --plugin-dir /path/to/clawcord`

---

To download the daemon binary manually (normally handled automatically by hooks):

```bash
sh scripts/install.sh
```

## Configuration

Clawcord uses a TOML config file at `~/.claude/clawcord/config.toml`. On first run, the daemon copies the defaults from [`config.default.toml`](config.default.toml).

Key settings:

| Section | Option | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `discord` | `app_id` | Discord application ID for Rich Presence |
| `display` | `details` / `state` | Format strings with `{project}`, `{branch}`, `{model}`, `{cost}`, `{tokens}` |
| `display.assets` | `show_model_icon` | Show model tier icon (opus/sonnet/haiku) |
| `display.buttons` | `show_repo_button` | Auto-detect git remote and show "View Repository" button |
| `display.format` | `model_name` | Model name style: `short`, `full`, or `raw` |
| `display.format` | `cost_format` / `token_format` | Cost/token display format |
| `display.format` | `branch` | Branch display: `show`, `hide`, or `hide_default` |
| `display.timestamps` | `mode` | Timer mode: `session` (per Claude session), `elapsed` (total daemon uptime), or `none` |
| `privacy` | `hide_project_name` | Replace project name with generic text |
| `privacy` | `ignore` | Directories where presence is hidden entirely |
| `behavior` | `presence_idle_minutes` | Minutes before presence hides from profile (daemon stays alive) |
| `behavior` | `daemon_idle_minutes` | Minutes before daemon exits (auto-restarts on next hook) |
| `behavior` | `idle_mode` | What to show when idle: `clear`, `idle_text`, or `last_activity` |
| `pricing` | `source` / `format` | Pricing data source (`url`, `file`, `static`) and parser (`openrouter`, `litellm`, `clawcord`) |
| `log` | `level` | Minimum log level: `trace`, `debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error` |

See [`config.default.toml`](config.default.toml) for the full reference with descriptions.

## Statusline Integration (Optional)

Clawcord can read Claude Code's statusline data for richer presence info. The install script sets this up automatically, but you can also configure it manually.

### Unix / macOS

Requires `jq`.

```bash
# Set up (backs up existing statusline)
sh scripts/statusline/unix/setup.sh

# Remove (restores original statusline)
sh scripts/statusline/unix/remove.sh
```

### Windows

Uses PowerShell (no external dependencies).

```powershell
# Set up (backs up existing statusline)
pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File scripts/statusline/windows/setup.ps1

# Remove (restores original statusline)
pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File scripts/statusline/windows/remove.ps1
```

## Architecture

```
hooks/hooks.json              Claude Code hook definitions
scripts/
  hooks/
    activity.sh               PreToolUse/PostToolUse — writes state.json, starts daemon
    stop.sh                   Stop — cleans up sessions, stops daemon when last exits
  statusline/
    unix/                     Statusline setup/teardown for Unix/macOS
    windows/                  Statusline setup/teardown for Windows
  daemon/
    start.sh / stop.sh        Manual daemon control
  install.sh                  Downloads the daemon binary + sets up statusline
cmd/
  clawcord/                   Daemon entry point
  buildver/                   Prints build version from release manifest
  genconfig/                  Codegen for config struct defaults and validation
internal/
  atomicfile/                 Temp-file-and-rename safe writes
  config/                     TOML config loading with codegen defaults
  discord/                    Discord IPC Rich Presence client
  integration/                End-to-end integration tests
  logger/                     Structured slog handler with file rotation (lumberjack)
  migrate/                    Config migration registry
  paths/                      Centralized data-directory file/dir name constants
  pricing/                    OpenRouter pricing lookups with embedded fallbacks
  remote/                     GitHub raw-content URL builder (ldflags or git remote)
  session/                    State file watcher and JSONL cost log parser
  tiers/                      Model tier config (remote -> cache -> embedded fallback)
  update/                     Version check against remote release manifest
tools/
  gen-assets/                 Renders Discord Rich Presence tier icons from tiers.json
data/
  tiers.json                  Model tier definitions (fetched at runtime too)
```

The daemon is a single Go binary that:
1. Watches `~/.claude/clawcord/state.json` for changes (written by hook scripts)
2. Connects to Discord via local IPC socket
3. Updates Rich Presence with project info, model, and cost data
4. Idles/exits automatically when no Claude Code sessions are active

## Building from Source

Requires Go 1.25+.

```bash
# Single platform
make build

# Run tests
make test

# Lint
make lint
```

## Platform Notes

The daemon and Discord IPC work natively on all platforms:

| Platform | Discord IPC | Statusline | Binary |
|---|---|---|---|
| Linux | Unix socket (`/tmp/discord-ipc-*`, Snap, Flatpak) | Supported | `clawcord` |
| macOS | Unix socket (`/tmp/discord-ipc-*`) | Supported | `clawcord` |
| Windows | Named pipe (`\\.\pipe\discord-ipc-*`) | Supported (PowerShell) | `clawcord.exe` |

Statusline integration is an optional enhancement. On Unix/macOS it requires bash and jq; on Windows it uses PowerShell. The daemon works without it on all platforms — it falls back to JSONL parsing for cost/token data.
